person.persName: James S. Wallace (Asst. Ed Lou Journal)

body.p: Born in New York in 1805. Married Eliza Wallace in Washington, D.C. in 1840. Newspaper editor at the Philadelphia Gazette and Philadelphia North American in Philadelphia Pennsylvania. Editor at the Pennsylvania Miner's Journal in Pottsville, Pennsylvania in 1838. Editor at the Harrisburg Telegraph in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania in 1840. Editor at the Philadelphia Forum in 1842. Agent for the Associated Press. Manager of the Louisville Theater in Louisville, Kentucky, 1858. Assistant Editor at the Louisville Journal from 1860 to 1865. Died in Louisville in February 1865.

bibl.p: The Louisville Journal, February 24, 1865. Reprinted from The Philadelphia North American Gazette. "The Late James S. Wallace," The Louisville Journal, February 28, 1865. Reprinted from The Philadelphia North American Gazette. (Pottsville) Pennsylvania Miner's Journal, February 25, 1865. “A National Loss,” The Louisville Journal, February 20, 1865.
